ESAD: A subtype of esophageal cancer, characterized by glandular differentiation of the tumor cells, often arising from Barrettâ€™s esophagus with mucin production, and typically showing irregular glandular structures and invasive growth patterns
ESCC: A subtype of esophageal cancer, characterized by the presence of keratinization and intercellular bridges in tumor cells, often forming sheets and nests, with varying degrees of cellular differentiation and dysplasia
